Today's Cameron-Osborne confidence means they feel they can cope with the loss of a valued and respected member of their court. one ally told me: David Cameron has grown into a natural prime minister and George Osborne 's reputation has been enhanced as chancellor. Their reliance on any one person is less than it was. In a way these remarks are a tribute to Andy Coulson . They show how David Cameron has grown in stature since Andy Coulson 's arrival in 2007. Kay Bailey Hutchison Kirsten Gillibrand of New York said in a statement Wednesday she's open to making improvements to the health care law, but the Republican repeal amendment amounted to "a political stunt." It would deny affordable health insurance to millions of families and eliminate important tax breaks for small businesses, Kirsten Gillibrand said. The title derives from a frequently parodied Donald Rumsfeld response to a reporter's question about whether there actually was evidence of any link between Saddam Hussein and terrorists seeking weapons of mass destruction. The Defense secretary responded: Reports that say that something hasn't happened are always interesting to me because, as we know, there are known knowns; there are things we know we know. We also know there are known unknowns; that is to say we know there are some things we do not know. But there are also unknown unknowns- the ones we don't know we don't know. It is, of course, a logical fallacy to multiply categories beyond necessity, but it's one Donald Rumsfeld has rhetorically mastered to create a self-conscious reputation as a fearless questioner of received truths, one he

Bloomberg News reported Thursday that the bonuses would average$ 10,000 for 10,755 salaried workers, but some who aren't covered by governmen t pay restrictions could get up to half their salary. Details regarding salaried performance awards are considered confidential employment records, Ranieri said. Chrysler CEO Sergio Marchionne has said the workers deserve bonuses even though the company lost money because of work they did in revamping or redesigning 16 models since the 2009 bankruptcy. The 51-year-old Mr. Mike Pence is a darling of social conservatives and often describes himself as a Christian, a conservative, and a Republican, in that order. when Gabrielle Giffords squeezed Kirsten Gillibrand 's hand and her right eye started to flicker, before finally opening wide. Debbie Wasserman Schultz says, "it was like she was trying to will her eyes open," adding: It felt like we were watching a miracle. Gabrielle Giffords ' other eye was damaged in the shooting and remains bandaged.( Copyright 2011 by The Associated Press. All Rights Reserved.) Share this article:

fresh off announcing a management shake-up, will give a USD 100 million equity award to outgoing Chief Executive Eric Schmidt , who in April will be succeeded by company co-founder Larry Page, says a media report. Google Inc. ... will give a USD 100 million equity award to outgoing Chief Executive Eric Schmidt , the Wall Street Journal reported. It was the first such award for Eric Schmidt since he joined the company in 2001. It includes stock and options, the report said citing a Google Inc. spokesperson as saying.

Eric Schmidt 's departure had been a long time coming, says Charles Arthur in The Guardian: After slipups with search, Street View and Android, it's clear that Google needs tighter control at the top- and Eric Schmidt is not the man for the job. What of Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin ? He is said to be focusing on strategic projects and is particularly interested in social networking.
